items.preText: 1:00pm Kieran Powell and Shai Hope to open. Mehidy Hasan has the ball. Around the wicket, a slip in place. Mashrafe hopes they end this year on a good note. "The first match is very important, Shakib and Tamim come back. Hopefully, we will do well today," he says. "The journey has been good. There have been some ups and downs but playing 200th game is a pleasure, all thanks to Allah." Powell says the reason behind batting first is the wicket may not be good to bat in the second innings. "In the last few days, we had some good net sessions. We have gone with the team we think is the best." It's warm and nice out there, historically it has been a chasing ground but in the last couple of years, that trend has changed a bit. Neil McKenzie says he is excited for Tamim's come back. And the prospect of so many good batsmen excites him. Talking about the opposition, he says West Indies have a varied attack but Bangladesh know the conditions well. Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Liton Das, 3 Imrul Kayes, 4 Soumya Sarkar, 5 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 6 Shakib Al Hasan, 7 Mahmudullah, 8 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Mustafizur Rahman, 11 Rubel Hossain West Indies: 1 Kieran Powell, 2 Shai Hope (wk), 3 Darren Bravo, 4 Marlon Samuels, 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Rovman Powell (capt), 7 Roston Chase, 8 Keemo Paul, 9 Devendra Bishoo, 10 Kemar Roach, 11 Oshane Thomas Bangladesh have made five changes to their side, bringing in Shakib Al Hasan, Tamim Iqbal, Mustafizur Rahman, Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Rubel Hossain. They have dropped Mohammad Mithun, Nazmul Islam, Mohammad Saifuddin, Abu Hider and Ariful Haque from their third ODI against Zimbabwe in October. Meanwhile, Darren Bravo and Roston Chase are in for the visitors in place of Jason Holder and Fabian Allen. Raqib: "How does West Indies a better side in ODI? They are 9th in ODI ranking having a difference of 21 rating points from 7th ranked Bangladesh whereas they are 8th in test. Considering the recent ODI performance of Bangladesh after 2015 world cup, especially at home, West Indies has even no chance to compete!" -- That's what I said, there last ODI series win was in 2014. REZA HASAN: "this one day series might be the last series at home for MASHRAFE !!!! he will be missed a lot :(" -- And Isam, right on cue, tells me this is Mashrafe's 200th ODI, 198 for Bangladesh and two for Asia XI. 12:30pm West Indies have won the toss and opted to bat first. Shojib Ahmed: "Specially ODI side, at present Bangladesh are in energetic side as Tamim and Shakib came back with Liton, Somya and Kayes recent best form. Mash has great great captaincy with bowling and the Fizz, Mehidy are in top side in the ICC rankings." MAKEDA: "Thanks for your comprehensive commentary espncricinfo because gone are the days of me losing my sleep to watch West Indies . We need better management !" Nazmus Sakib: "Can anyone remember when was the last time Bangladesh faced such a happy dilemma that they need to drop an in-form performer because the one replacing him is statistically more impactful? " REZA HASAN: "Hoping for a great contest, 1st ODI is so much important for series , i think WINDIES have some great power hitters .. though dew would be a major factor. " Isam is at the venue and says: The crowd is already coming in. Likely to be a full house. Usama: "The match is going to be lit! WI are suffering from bad loses, but they are always a better side in ODI or T20. On the other hand, a fresh hot series win,home ground advantage and Tamim Iqbal booster really make BD a tougher side to break. Hoping for a cracking 8 hours thriller!! " H.M. Rahat: "Bangladesh has now achieve strong place in ODI cricket. And after a long time Tamim and Sakib return. So it will be almost impossible to defend bangladesh for west indies." Rovman Powell, however, believes he has seen signs of progress during their ODI series in India where they won one and tied another match in the five-match series. "We have played some lovely cricket in India but we didn't get the results that we wanted," he said on the eve of the game. "A few series before the World Cup, it will be good to get the series win under our belt." While everybody talks about West Indies being a stronger side in limited-overs cricket, well that may be true for T20Is but in ODIs, the numbers are not in their favour. They haven't won an ODI series since August 2014, when they beat Bangladesh 3-0 at home. 12:00pm Hello and welcome to the last ODI series of 2018. It's West Indies taking on Bangladesh in the first of the three-match series in Dhaka. After being blanked 2-0 in the Test series, West Indies will look to salvage some pride in the white-ball cricket. Darren Bravo is back for them as they gear up under their new ODI captain Rovman Powell. Meanwhile, Tamim Iqbal's return would give Bangladesh a happy headache. He averages 90.16 in nine ODIs this year, having scored two hundreds and four fifties. The toss is about half an hour away. And in the meantime, you can apprise yourself by reading Mohammad Isam's preview for the game.

items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: floated outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards short extra cover

items.text: punches this length ball towards mid-off to get off the mark
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, 1 run

items.preText: Over the wicket to the right-hander
items.text: flighted on middle and leg, tucked away towards midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Spin from both ends, here's Shakib, around the wicket
items.text: length outside off, punched towards mid-off
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Over the wicket now for Powell
items.text: length on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg, Hope was sprinting down but Powell sends him back just in time
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: length on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg once again
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: fuller on the stumps, clips it towards deep square leg and gets to the other end
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, 1 run

items.text: tossed up outside off, Hope comes forward and drives it past the extra cover fielder on his left, first four of the day
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: flighted again, looks to whip it through covers once more, gets an inside edge past the stumps, short fine leg tidies up
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: length outside off, goes back and punches it towards extra cover
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: slower, just around off, hardly turn there, defended on the front foot
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: length outside off, Powell was unsure whether to go forward or back, hangs his bat there, an inside edge towards short fine leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: a touch fuller this time, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, 1 run

items.text: length, on the stumps, defended
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: length on middle and leg, pushed towards square leg
items.postText: Shuvo Shafiqur : "The color of this wicket reminds me of earlier BNS days. The management team deciding to practice on flattish deck would test our bowlers a lot more than usual. This is a positive move and i am looking forward to how both Batting and Bowling unit respond. "
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: length outside off, was playing for the spin, it goes straight with the arm to beat the bat as he pushes at it
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: back of length outside off, punched towards extra cover off the back foot
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: fuller in the arc and Powell goes over the head of the bowler, four down the ground
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball, on the pads, flicked towards square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, no run

items.text: short of length, on middle and leg, punched towards long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to KOA Powell, 1 run

items.text: flighted outside off from around the wicket, comes forward and blocks
items.postText: Nitish: "If Powell gets to 1000 runs today, will he be the slowest opener in ODI history to get to 1000 runs ?" -- I guess the list would be dominated by many lower-order batsmen, so no, I don't think so
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: fuller outside off and driven on the front foot towards long-off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to KOA Powell, 1 run
